abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Bosnia Forestry Project, which constructs forest roads.
            Positive effects achieved from different aspects are far
            more significant, observed on a long-term basis, than
            negative effects caused by road construction and
            utilization. Some of those negative environmental impacts
            and measures to mitigate them are described here: During the
            construction phase, use soil and humus after construction
            for topsoil or use borrows with valid operating license. To
            alleviate mud and dust, wet or cover truck load. Use
            alternative routes to minimize noise, vehicle exhaust, and
            road congestion. During operation, limit activities to
            daylight working hours and operate equipment with mufflers
            to reduce noise disturbance and lessen vibrations. Cover
            working areas, use sealed formwork, isolate wash down areas,
            collect and dispose of waste material at appropriate
            locations, secure storage and ensure proper loading of fuel
            along with maintaining equipment to prevent water and soil
            contamination. Avoid crop and tree destruction by
            appropriately handling machines and paying compensation for
            damages. Prevent oil and fuel spills to reduce air, water,
            and soil pollution. Workers will be supplied with safety
            instructions and protective gear. To control vehicle speed,
            install traffic and warning signs. To limit traffic volume,
            monitor movement of cattle. To minimize danger of erosion,
            landslides, and hazardous conditions, install nets and
            warnings, and repair roads.
